page.title: 02HAZEL GROVE STATION.
page.content: There were originally two stations at Hazel Grove, one operated by the Midland Railway which was closed in the early 1930's. The track is still in use for freight only, but from next year it will carry diverted passenger traffic from Manchester to the South of England via Sheffield. Engineering work is currently in progress to connect a new link line. The existing station is on the suburban line and carries heavy commuter traffic. The station was rebuilt in 1977. The Buxton/Manchester service is operated by diesel multiple units. Since early 1980 electric multiple units have operated through services to Altrincham station. The road bridge is narrow and hazardous. It is scheduled to be widened next year.Bus and rail services combine at the station.There is also a free car park.
